title: DISARM Civil Society Subset
description: Curated subset of DISARM techniques most relevant to civil society organizations
selection_criteria: Techniques selected based on documented attacks against civil society, journalists, human rights defenders, and advocacy organizations

categories.name: Narrative Attacks
categories.description: Techniques for creating and spreading false or misleading narratives about your organization

techniques.name: Develop Competing Narratives
techniques.description: Create alternative narratives that compete with your messaging
techniques.civil_society_example: False claims about your funding sources, motives, or foreign connections
indicators: Claims you're funded by foreign governments

techniques.name: Leverage Conspiracy Theory Narratives
techniques.description: Connect your organization to existing conspiracy theories
techniques.civil_society_example: Linking your org to 'Soros', 'globalist', or other conspiracy narratives
indicators: Your org mentioned alongside conspiracy keywords
Viral posts connecting you to shadowy networks

techniques.name: Distort Facts
techniques.description: Take real information and present it misleadingly
techniques.civil_society_example: Quotes taken out of context, selective editing of your statements

techniques.name: Demand Insurmountable Proof
techniques.description: Require unrealistic evidence standards for your claims while spreading unverified attacks
techniques.civil_society_example: Dismissing your documented evidence while amplifying unverified accusations

techniques.name: Respond to Breaking News Event or Active Crisis
techniques.description: Exploit news events to inject false narratives about your organization
techniques.civil_society_example: Using a crisis to blame your org or spread false claims about your involvement
indicators: Rapid narrative attacks timed to news events

techniques.name: Discredit Credible Sources
techniques.description: Attack the credibility of your organization or staff
techniques.civil_society_example: Campaigns to label you as biased, foreign agents, or untrustworthy

techniques.name: Create Fake Research
techniques.description: Fabricate studies or data to counter your work
techniques.civil_society_example: Fake surveys showing public opposition, fabricated expert opinions
indicators: Research from unknown institutions contradicting your findings

categories.name: Impersonation & Persona Operations
categories.description: Techniques for creating fake identities or impersonating real people/organizations

techniques.name: Present Persona
techniques.description: Create and operate fake personas
techniques.civil_society_example: Fake accounts posing as supporters, journalists, or researchers
indicators: New accounts with limited history engaging with your work

techniques.name: Activist Persona
techniques.description: Create fake activist accounts to infiltrate or discredit movements
techniques.civil_society_example: Fake supporters who later make extreme statements attributed to your org
indicators: Accounts that seem too perfectly aligned

techniques.name: Impersonated Persona
techniques.description: Impersonate real staff members or your organization
techniques.civil_society_example: Fake social media accounts using your org name, fake emails from 'staff'
indicators: Reports of accounts using your branding
Emails claiming to be from you that you didn't send

techniques.name: Co-Opt Trusted Sources
techniques.description: Manipulate or impersonate trusted individuals/orgs
techniques.civil_society_example: Compromising partner accounts, fake endorsements
indicators: Partners sharing content they normally wouldn't
Unexpected endorsements or attacks from trusted sources

techniques.name: Infiltrate Existing Networks
techniques.description: Place operatives within your organization or supporter base
techniques.civil_society_example: Agents joining as staff, volunteers, or coalition members
indicators: New members with unusual interest in sensitive information
Information leaks after new members join

categories.name: Harassment & Intimidation
categories.description: Techniques for targeting individuals within your organization

techniques.name: Harass
techniques.description: Conduct harassment campaigns against individuals
techniques.civil_society_example: Coordinated harassment of staff on social media, threatening messages

techniques.name: Harass People Based on Identities
techniques.description: Target individuals based on their identity characteristics
techniques.civil_society_example: Gendered harassment, racial attacks, LGBTQ+ targeting of staff
indicators: Focus on personal characteristics rather than work

techniques.name: Threaten to Dox
techniques.description: Threaten to release personal information
techniques.civil_society_example: Threats to reveal home addresses, family information
indicators: Messages threatening to expose personal information
Hints that attackers know private details

techniques.name: Dox
techniques.description: Publish private personal information
techniques.civil_society_example: Home addresses, family members, personal photos posted online
indicators: Personal information appearing on hostile forums

techniques.name: Intimidate
techniques.description: Actions intended to frighten or coerce
techniques.civil_society_example: Physical surveillance, implied threats, menacing messages
indicators: Threatening but not explicitly illegal messages

techniques.name: Physical Violence
techniques.description: Actual or threatened physical violence
techniques.civil_society_example: Assault on staff, attacks on offices

techniques.name: Flood Information Space
techniques.description: Overwhelm with volume of content
techniques.civil_society_example: Flooding your hashtags, overwhelming your comment sections

techniques.name: Trolls Amplify and Manipulate
techniques.description: Human operators amplifying attacks
techniques.civil_society_example: Coordinated commenting, reply-guying, sea-lioning
indicators: Accounts that seem to be always online

techniques.name: Bots Amplify via Automated Forwarding and Reposting
techniques.description: Automated accounts amplifying content
techniques.civil_society_example: Bot networks amplifying attacks against your org

techniques.name: Conduct Swarming
techniques.description: Coordinated attack by many accounts simultaneously
techniques.civil_society_example: Pile-ons where many accounts attack a single post or person
indicators: Accounts that don't normally interact joining in

categories.name: Platform Manipulation
categories.description: Techniques for manipulating platform systems against you

techniques.name: Report Non-Violative Opposing Content
techniques.description: Mass report your content to trigger automated takedowns
techniques.civil_society_example: Coordinated false reports to get your accounts suspended
indicators: Content removed for violations you didn't commit

techniques.name: Manipulate Platform Algorithm
techniques.description: Game platform systems to suppress or promote content
techniques.civil_society_example: SEO attacks, manipulating search results about your org
indicators: Negative content ranking highly for your org name
Suppression of your content in feeds

techniques.name: Use Search Engine Optimization
techniques.description: Manipulate search results
techniques.civil_society_example: Negative SEO making attack content appear for your org name
indicators: Attack sites appearing in top search results

techniques.name: Obtain Private Documents
techniques.description: Acquire internal documents through hacking or other means
techniques.civil_society_example: Email hacks, document theft for strategic leaking

techniques.name: Alter Authentic Documents
techniques.description: Modify real documents before leaking
techniques.civil_society_example: Doctored emails or documents released as 'leaks'
indicators: Documents that seem real but contain false elements

usage_guidance.threat_modeling: When mapping threats, select relevant categories and techniques based on adversary profiles. Not all techniques will be relevant to all organizations.
usage_guidance.detection: Use indicators to monitor for attacks. Prioritize based on adversary relevance and organizational exposure.
usage_guidance.response: Document incidents using DISARM IDs for consistent tracking and information sharing.
usage_guidance.sharing: DISARM IDs enable standardized communication with peer organizations, platforms, and security researchers.
